tourBios.otherCarHigh: North Coast Section Champion...Earned All League honors all four years at Monte Vista High School in Danville, CA...Recorded two collegiate wins and was named to the West Coast Conference first-team three times...Academic All American in 2006...Was low amateur at the 2006 U.S. Open in his only PGA TOUR appearance.
tourBios.personal: Sister is a gymnast and feature twirler at the University of South Carolina...Golf instructor is Bill Harmon...Biggest thrill outside golf was being an Academic All-American at Pepperdine...Always marks his ball with a skull ball marker...Favorite college teams are Pepperdine and the USC Trojans. Favorite pro teams are the Oakland Raiders and Oakland A's...Favorite TV shows are "Pawn Stars," "Storage Wars," and "The Big Bang Theory." Favorite athletes to watch are Michael Phelps and Usain Bolt...Favorite cities to visit are Tokyo and New York...The snacks he keeps in his golf bag are beef jerky and Clif bars...Favorite app is "Words with Friends." Not many people know that he grew up in Guam...Dream foursome includes Arnold Palmer, Byron Nelson and Retief Goosen...Bucket list includes traveling to Europe, winning a major and giving back to charities...Charities he supports includes Gilda's Club and the Salvation Army...Favorite quote: "It's not how you fall, it's how you get up."
tourBios.otherInfo: Has played on the Golden State Tour, Gateway Tour, eGolf Tour, National Professional Golf Tour and four years on the Canadian Tour.

tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was the low amateur at the 2006 U.S. Open
tourBios.otherInfo: Finalist for the 2006 Byron Nelson Award, WCC All- Conference 2004, 2005, and 2006, 2006 Academic All-American, Collected a pair of collegiate titles while at Pepperdine, He has also played on the Nationwide, Gateway, Cleveland Golf, and Golden State Tours

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T13th in 2012 at the Mexico Open Presented by Banamex.
